intro: Hieracium vulgatum subsp. subviriduliceps, commonly known as the green-headed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine, hairy hairs. The plant produces yellow composite flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are lance-shaped, with a rough, hairy texture and often have a reddish or purplish underside. This subspecies is known for its distinctive greenish-yellow flower heads, which give it its common name.
